stanza.line: Look in thy glass and tell the face thou viewest
Now is the time that face should formanother
Whose fresh repair if now thou not renewest
Thou dost beguile the world unbless somemother
For where is she so fair whose unearedwomb
Disdains the tillage of thy husbandry
Or who is he so fond will be thetomb
Of his self love to stop posterity
Thou art thy mother glass and she in thee
Calls back the lovely April of herprime
So thou through windows of thineseeseesee
Despite of wrinkles this thy goldentime
But if thou live remembered notbebe
